subject: Photography
title: The Blue Marble
description: A quick, practical guide to The Blue Marble.

hook.text: In 1972, the Apollo 17 crew took the first fully illuminated photograph of Earth. The whole planet, in one frame.

buildup.text: Previous space photos showed only partial views. This was the complete Blue Marble ‚Äî clouds, oceans, continents.

discovery.text: It became the most reproduced photograph in history. Every globe icon on your devices descends from it.

twist.text: Seeing the whole Earth at once made borders seem arbitrary. One planet, no walls visible from space.

climax.text: The Blue Marble didn't just show us what Earth looks like. It showed us what we share.

punchline.text: From far enough away, we're all on the same team.

quiz.question: What made 'The Blue Marble' photograph unique?
options: It was the first fully lit image of the entire Earth
It was taken from the moon's surface
